meanings.definition: A small circle whose center moves around the circumference of a larger circle.
meanings.sent1: The model of the solar system with epicycles helped explain the movement of planets.
meanings.sent2: Ancient astronomers used epicycles to describe the paths of celestial bodies.
meanings.sent3: The epicycles in the sky danced gracefully around the main circle.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts revolved like epicycles around a central idea.
meanings.sent5: The concept of epicycles made the planetary motion easier to visualize.

meanings.definition: A theory in ancient astronomy that planets move in small circles within the orbit of a larger circle.
meanings.sent1: The astronomers' epicycles theory was a key aspect of their understanding of planetary motion.
meanings.sent2: Studying epicycles was crucial for ancient astronomers to predict planetary positions.
meanings.sent3: The planets' playful epicycles within their orbits amused the astronomers.
meanings.sent4: The idea of epicycles within epicycles added complexity to the ancient model of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The intricate dance of epicycles within orbits fascinated the scholars of old.
